fde0e1b6d28a028223eac893278e36f618a31d55|2020-10-09|mmorale3|Added a new access pattern to the (still global) stack memory resources, following a monostate pattern. Manager classes control access to the global state, which can still be accessed anywhere in the code. This is a first change in a series of modifications needed to enable newer features from cuda including support for cuda11 new interface for sparse matrix multiplication, cutensor and the new mixed precision blas routines in cublas.

9f7a42b5799f2d52f21cff58da843b2ad9de6045|2020-05-07|mmorale3|vbias and vHS in all classes in HamiltonianOperations now accept parameters in either precision, regardless of the working precision of the class. Appropriate casting will be done based on parameter types. This is a preparation of changes in Propagator that will keep G, vbias, vHS and X in single precision during mixed precision builds, cutting the memory usage of of the propagator almost in half, this is fine since all hamops objects were casting internally to single precision in mixed precision runs anyway. This is also a first step in making the working precision of hamops classes a runtime choice with templated implementations

cb8d270338e8f1147671f535c1e2e941ebd52815|2019-11-11|Joshua P. Townsend|Numerous fixes for unit test:  - Fixed the failure in mixed precision builds.    In the original test, one of the bins aligned exactly with the particle separation. This resulted in different bins being incremented in single/double precision builds. This has now been fixed by setting the number of gofr bins to be odd. mixed and double precision builds now agree and pass.  - Increased the tolerance of the unit test checks.    In the original test, the tolerance was set to be fairly low, 1E-01. This corresponded to an oversight on my part. I had incorrectly compared the exact analytic result to the gofr, which isn't correct. That is because gofr is computed at only a set number of distances. The fix was to compute the expected value of gofr analytically for the corresponding bin. Now the tolerance has been increased by an order of magnitude to 1E-02. Further increases would cause mixed precision builds to fail the test.
